intro: Furcraea guerrerensis, commonly known as the Guerrerensis sword fern, is a member of the Asphodelaceae family native to Central America. It is a robust, evergreen plant characterized by its long, narrow, sword-shaped leaves that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant typically thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine and ornamental horticulture due to their aesthetic appeal and resilience. Furcraea guerrerensis is also valued for its ability to adapt to arid conditions, making it a suitable plant for xeriscaping.
